comments.body:
Almost all modules use `dict()` constructor here.

`required: False`, `default: None`, and `type: 'str'` are defaults and not required.

Not really a blocker, more advisory.
Thanks, I'll keep it in mind.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +485,489 @@    argument_spec = ec2_argument_spec()
    argument_spec.update(dict(
        state={'required': True, 'choices': ['present', 'absent', 'rebooted']},
        name={'required': True},
        engine={'required': False, 'default': 'memcached'},
